translated: The Questions of King Milinda
The Chapter on Emancipation
The Question about Making Effort
The King said:
“Revered Nāgasena, you say:

original: ‘kinti imaṁ dukkhaṁ nirujjheyya, aññañca dukkhaṁ nuppajjeyyāti.
analyzed: kinti imam dukkham nirujjheyya aññam ca dukkham nuppajjeyya ati
translated: ‘How can this suffering cease and no other suffering arise?

analyzed: etad atthā mahā rāja amhākam pabbajjā ati
translated: That is the purpose of our going forth.’

original: Kiṁ paṭikacceva vāyamitena, nanu sampatte kāle vāyamitabban”ti?
analyzed: kim paṭikaccā iva vāyamitena nanu sampatte kāle vāyamitabbanti
translated: Why should one make effort beforehand? Should one not make effort when the time has come?”
The Elder said:

original: “sampatte kāle, mahārāja, vāyāmo akiccakaro bhavati, paṭikacceva vāyāmo kiccakaro bhavatī”ti.
analyzed: sampatte kāle mahā rāja vāyāmaḥ a kicca karaḥ bhavati paṭikaccā iva vāyāmaḥ kicca karaḥ bhavati iti
translated: “When the time has come, sire, effort is ineffective; effort made beforehand is effective.”
“Make a simile.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, mahārāja, yadā tvaṁ pipāsito bhaveyyāsi, tadā tvaṁ udapānaṁ khaṇāpeyyāsi, taḷākaṁ khaṇāpeyyāsi ‘pānīyaṁ pivissāmī’”ti?
analyzed: tam kim maññasi mahā rāja yadā tvam pipāsitaḥ bhaveyyāsi tadā tvam udapānam khaṇā peyyāsi taḷākam khaṇā peyyāsi pānīyam pivissāmi iti
translated: “What do you think about this, sire? When you are thirsty, would you have a well dug or a tank dug so that you could drink water?”
“No, revered sir.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, sampatte kāle vāyāmo akiccakaro bhavati, paṭikacceva vāyāmo kiccakaro bhavatī”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja sampatte kāle vāyāmaḥ a kicca karaḥ bhavati paṭikaccā iva vāyāmaḥ kicca karaḥ bhavati iti
translated: “Even so, sire, when the time has come effort is ineffective; effort made beforehand is effective.”
“Make another simile.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, mahārāja, yadā tvaṁ bubhukkhito bhaveyyāsi, tadā tvaṁ khettaṁ kasāpeyyāsi, sāliṁ ropāpeyyāsi, dhaññaṁ atiharāpeyyāsi ‘bhattaṁ bhuñjissāmī’”ti?
analyzed: tam kim maññasi mahā rāja yadā tvam bubhukkhitaḥ bhaveyyāsi tadā tvam khettam kasāpeyyāsi sālim ropāpeyyāsi dhaññam atiharāpeyyāsi bhattam bhuñjissāmi iti
translated: “What do you think, great king? When you are hungry, do you first plough a field, sow it, and then reap the harvest, pound it, winnow it, grind it into flour, and bake cakes, before you eat, or do you eat first and then do all that?”
“No, Reverend Sir.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, sampatte kāle vāyāmo akiccakaro bhavati, paṭikacceva vāyāmo kiccakaro bhavatī”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja sampatte kāle vāyāmaḥ a kicca karaḥ bhavati paṭikaccā iva vāyāmaḥ kicca karaḥ bhavati iti
translated: “So too, great king, when the time has come, striving is useless, and striving beforehand is fruitful.”

original: “Bhiyyo opammaṁ karohī”ti.🔽“Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, mahārāja, yadā te saṅgāmo paccupaṭṭhito bhaveyya, tadā tvaṁ parikhaṁ
analyzed: bhiyyas opammam karohi iti  tam kim maññasi mahā rāja yadā te saṅgāmaḥ paccupaṭṭhitaḥ bhaveyya tadā tvam
translated: “Please give me another illustration.”

original: khaṇāpeyyāsi, pākāraṁ kārāpeyyāsi, gopuraṁ kārāpeyyāsi, aṭṭālakaṁ kārāpeyyāsi, dhaññaṁ🔽atiharāpeyyāsi, tadā tvaṁ hatthismiṁ sikkheyyāsi, assasmiṁ sikkheyyāsi, rathasmiṁ
analyzed: khaṇāpeyyā asi pākāram kārāpeyyā asi gopuram kārāpeyyā asi aṭṭālakam kārāpeyyā asi dhañña  tadā tvam hatthismim sikkheyyāsi assasmim sikkheyyāsi rathasmi
translated: “What do you think, great king? When you are about to do battle, do you first have a trench dug, a rampart built, a wall constructed, a gate set up, and a lookout tower built, and then do you store grain,

analyzed: sikkheyyāsi dhanusmim sikkheyyāsi tharusmim sikkheyyāsi iti
translated: and then train yourself in elephants, horses, chariots, archery, and swords, or do you do all that afterwards?”
“No, Reverend Sir.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, sampatte kāle vāyāmo akiccakaro bhavati, paṭikacceva vāyāmo kiccakaro bhavati.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja sampatte kāle vāyāmaḥ a kicca karaḥ bhavati paṭikaccā iva vāyāmaḥ kicca karaḥ bhavati
translated: “So too, sire, when the time has come, striving is useless, but striving beforehand is useful.
And this, sire, was said by the Blessed One:
‘One should do what is good for oneself🔽before the time has come;
The wise one should strive

analyzed: na sākaṭika cintāya  mantā dhīraḥ parakkame
translated: not with the thought of a carter.
As a carter, having left🔽the level, good road,
and having gone on a bad road,

analyzed: akkha chinnaḥ uva jhāyati  evam dhammāḥ apakkamma
translated: is destroyed with his wheels broken,🔽so the fool, having left the Dhamma
and having followed what is not Dhamma,
is destroyed, having fallen into the mouth of death,
like the one with his wheels broken.’“
“You are skilled, revered Nāgasena.”
The fifth discussion is concluded.
